result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler A. LINDSTROM was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin 2nd or subsequent offense (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to all other sentences 10 CF 58, 09 CF 271 and Ozaukee County 15 CF 240.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any known drug users or dealers.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.  
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer of within 1,000 feet of park on count 1.  Motion granted.    
Count 1 - Deliver Heroin - 2nd or subsequent offense - No contest plea.  Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-12-16 at 1:30 p.m.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2-6.  Motion granted.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing is set for 01-08-16 at 4:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for preliminary hearing on 01-08-16 at 9:00 a.m.
Copy filed.
Warrant cancelled and returned to Clerk of Court.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-08-16 at 9:00 a.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.   Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance is set for 12-21-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Copy filed.
Original Bench Warrant returned to Clerk of Court Office because an amended warrant has been issued.
RE:  Deliver heroin within 1000 feet of park as repeater, on 03-27-15.
